channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: A new era for storage? Researchers crack world record for smallest QR code, which could be “indefinitely” durable and require no energy or cooling
item.description: There's a new Guinness World Record for the smallest nanoscale QR codes, promising durable, energy-free storage at massive densities.

item.title: The ‘Mutant Mayhem 2’ Release Date Will Shift Until Morale Improves
item.description: Can we get the 'Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem' sequel date a little higher? Paramount says 'yes.'

item.title: Arturia’s FX Collection 6 adds two new effects and a $99 intro version
item.description: Arturia launched a new version of its flagship effects suite, FX Collection, which includes two new plugins, EFX Ambient and Pitch Shifter-910. FX Collection 6 also marks the introduction of an Intro version with a selection of six effects covering the basics for $99. That pales in comparison to the 39 effects in the full […]

item.title: Google Maps : pourquoi votre façon d’utiliser le GPS va devoir changer
item.description: Regardez bien votre écran la prochaine fois que vous cherchez une adresse sur Google Maps. Si vous n'êtes pas connecté à votre compte, Google Maps vient de devenir une coquille à moitié vide.

item.title: The Stop Killing Games campaign will set up NGOs in the EU and US
item.description: The Stop Killing Games campaign is evolving into more than just a movement. In a YouTube video, the campaign's creator, Ross Scott, explained that organizers are planning to establish two non-governmental organizations, one for the European Union and another for the US. According to Scott, these NGOs would allow for "long-term counter lobbying" when publishers end support for certain video games. "Let me start off by saying I think we're going to win this, namely the problem of publishers destroying video games that you've already paid for," Scott said in the video. According to Scott, the NGO...

item.title: Sony’s WH-CH720N headphones offer excellent value at full price, but right now they're a steal.
item.description: Sony’s WH-CH720N headphones offer excellent value at full price, but right now they're a steal.

item.title: Wikipedia blacklists Archive.today after alleged DDoS attack
item.description: Wikipedia editors have decided to remove all links to Archive.today, a web archiving service that they said has been linked to more than 695,000 times across the online encyclopedia.

item.title: The Legend That Defined the Music of ‘Final Fantasy’ Is Getting the Biography He Deserves
item.description: Read the story of longtime 'Final Fantasy' composer Nobuo Uematsu when his 'On the Record' biography hit stores this fall.

item.title: 'No one deploys AI at Meta’s scale': Meta signs up Nvidia to power its next big AI projects — so what exactly do Mark Zuckerberg and Jensen Huang have planned?
item.description: Meta partners with Nvidia to deploy millions of GPUs and CPUs, building scalable, privacy-focused AI infrastructure for global applications.
